role.name: AIN0
role.desc: Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

role.name: INT2
role.desc: External Interrupt source 2 to the MCU.

role.name: AIN1
role.desc: Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

role.name: OC0
role.desc: 8-bit Timer/Counter0 Output Compare Match Output. Pin can serve as an external output for timer 0 compare match. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function.

role.name: /SS
role.desc: Slave Select pin for using with SPI.

role.name: MOSI
role.desc: Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

role.name: MISO
role.desc: Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

role.name: SCK
role.desc: Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

role.name: /RESET
role.desc: Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

role.name: XTAL2
role.desc: Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)

role.name: XTAL1
role.desc: Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)

role.name: RXD
role.desc: Receive Data (data input pin for the UART). When the UART receiver is enabled, this pin is configured as an input. When the UART forces this pin to be an input, a logical state on PORT register will turn on the internal pull-up.

role.name: TXD
role.desc: Transmit Data (data output pin for the UART). When the UART transmitter is enabled, this pin is configured as an output.

role.name: INT0
role.desc: External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU.

role.name: INT1
role.desc: External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU.

role.name: OC1B
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: OC1A
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Output compare matchA output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: OC2
role.desc: 8-bit Timer/Counter2 output compare match output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter2 output compare. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. The OC2 pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

role.name: SCL
role.desc: 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.

role.name: SDA
role.desc: 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.

role.name: TCK
role.desc: JTAG - Test Clock. JTAG operation is synchronous to TCK.

role.name: TMS
role.desc: JTAG - Test Mode Select. This pin is used for navigating through the TAP-controller.

role.name: TDO
role.desc: JTAG - Test Data Out. Serial output data from Instruction register or Data Register.

role.name: TDI
role.desc: JTAG - Test Data In. Serial input data to be shifted in to the Instruction Register or Data Register (Scan Chains).

role.name: TOSC1
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Oscillator pin 1 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1.

role.name: TOSC2
role.desc: 16-bit Timer/Counter1 Oscillator pin 2 - clock source for asynchronous clocking of Timer/Counter1.
